repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Provincial Bank Privatization
            Loan Project and Bank Reform Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This implementation completion report
            covers the Provincial Bank Privatization Loan Project and
            the Bank Reform Loan Project. The two loans were analyzed
            together because of their twin nature - identical timing and
            similar purpose. The outcome of both loans were rated
            satisfactory. Among the lessons applicable to both loans
            are: 1) Financial/fiscal crises offer opportunities for
            structural change in banking. 2) Structural/ownership change
            in banking requires resources to restructure past losses. 3)
            Even when sufficient financial resources are available,
            there will be selection bias in the roster of potential
            acquirers. It is unclear whether program design features
            alone can overcome that bias. 4) Funds were disbursed only
            after the careful review of the individual transactions. 5)
            Some of the banks created through these transactions may
            require additional restructuring as market conditions
            change. Some failures need to be anticipated. 6) A strong
            borrower commitment is indispensable in such complicated,
            time-intensive transactions.

18225126.theme: Other financial and private sector development,State-owned enterprise restructuring and privatization,International financial standards and systems,Regulation and competition policy,Macroeconomic management
18225126.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Economic management

abstracts.cdata!:
Because of past mismanagement and
            ongoing deposit losses, the equity of provincial banks has
            turned sharply negative and their liquidity has become
            precarious. These banks are now draining already weak
            provincial finances and present a systemic risk to the
            banking system. Thus the provincial as well as the federal
            authorities have asked for urgent financial assistance in
            pursuing privatization as a way to restructure and sell the
            remaining sound assets and liabilities to the private
            sector. The Provincial Bank Privatization Loan adjustment
            operation is directed at assisting the national government
            to provide an orderly framework in which federal financial
            support for costs associated with privatization/closure is
            provided, subject to: (i) legislative authorization of
            privatization at the provincial level; (ii) intervention of
            the Superintendency of Banks; (iii) change of management;
            (iv) a time-bound, transparent privatization process; (v)
            timely resolution of residual assets and liabilities; and
            (vi) bank closure in the event of failed privatization. The
            loan is expected to support the privatization of some
            fifteen provincial banks, representing about 10% of total
            banking or 40% of provincial banking assets.
